it-001.text: Repeated, disturbing, and unwanted memories of the stressful experience?

it-002.text: Repeated, disturbing dreams of the stressful experience?

it-003.text: Suddenly feeling or acting as if the stressful experience were actually happening again (as if you were actually back there reliving it)?

it-004.text: Feeling very upset when something reminded you of the stressful experience?

it-005.text: Having strong physical reactions when something reminded you of the stressful experience (for example, heart pounding, trouble breathing, sweating)?

it-006.text: Avoiding memories, thoughts, or feelings related to the stressful experience?

it-007.text: Avoiding external reminders of the stressful experience (for example, people, places, conversations, activities, objects, or situations)?

it-008.text: Trouble remembering important parts of the stressful experience?

it-009.text: Having strong negative beliefs about yourself, other people, or the world (for example, having thoughts such as: I am bad, there is something seriously wrong with me, no one can be trusted, the world is completely dangerous)?

it-010.text: Blaming yourself or someone else for the stressful experience or what happened after it?

it-011.text: Having strong negative feelings such as fear, horror, anger, guilt, or shame?

it-012.text: Loss of interest in activities that you used to enjoy?

it-013.text: Feeling distant or cut off from other people?

it-014.text: Trouble experiencing positive feelings (for example, being unable to feel happiness or have loving feelings for people close to you)?

it-015.text: Irritable behaviour, angry outbursts, or acting aggressively?

it-016.text: Taking too many risks or doing things that could cause you harm?

it-017.text: Being “superalert” or watchful or on guard?
